intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a new Ceylon project, a Ceylon module contained in that project, and finally export the module to an external Ceylon module repository.

item.title: Open the Java Perspective
item.description: We need to be in the Java Perspective. Select Window > Open Perspective > Java from the menu bar at the top of the workbench, or click below. (If you're already in the Java perspective, you can skip this step.)

item.title: Create a Ceylon project
item.description:
First, we'll create a project using the New Ceylon Project wizard. Select File > New > Ceylon Project or click below.
Call the project "modules", or whatever you like, and click Finish.

item.title: Create a Ceylon module
item.description:
Next, we'll create the Ceylon module using the New Ceylon Module wizard. Select File > New > Ceylon Module or click below.
Call the module "hello", or whatever you like, choose the source folder of the project we just created, and finally click Finish.

item.title: Add code to the run method
Export the module
item.description:
Finally, select the project in the Package Explorer and select File > Export... > Ceylon > Ceylon Module to Module Repository or click below.
Choose the project we just created, and a Ceylon module repository on your filesystem. Click Finish to export our new module to the module repository.
You can now run the module on the Ceylon module runtime using the ceylon command line tool.
